translation.helpText: Name of the report. Real-time report is a report which captures the vitals and waves at the trigger time.
Name of the report. Vital signs report displays periodically recorded vital parameters such as heart rate, SpO₂, and blood pressure.
Name of the report. Tabular trend report displays vitals or measurements over time in a structured table format for easy comparison.
Name of the report (Translations should be Consistent with UI text SYN_UI_REPORT_GRAPHICAL_TREND). Graphical trend report displays time-series graphs to visualize trends over a period.
Name of the report which contains both EWS summary and its results. The report shows Early Warning Scores with corresponding clinical parameters and assessments.
The type of the patient in the report. Translation should be consistent with SYN_PTMT_PATIENT_TYPE
Date of birth of the patient in the report
Weight of the patient in the report
Height of the patient in the report
Paced mode of patient in the report. Translation should be consistent with SYN_PTMT_PACED_MODE
Age of patient in the report(Translations should be Consistent with UI text SYN_UI_AGE)
BSA (Body Surface Area) of patient in the report
Sex at birth of patient in the report. Translation should be consistent with SYN_PTMT_SEX_AT_BIRTH
Active alarms section in real-time report
Numerics section in real-time report
Indication of the page number in the report's footer
Date section of the vital signs trend report
Vitals section of the report (Translations should be Consistent with UI text SYN_UI_SPOTCHECK_VITALS)
Last page of the report
Room number of the patient in the report
Report generation date and time (do we have enough space to write date and time in the string?)
Admission date and time of patient (do we have enough space to write date and time in the string?)
Observations about patient (Translations should be Consistent with UI text SYN_UI_OBSERVATIONS)
Time frame of the trends in the report
Date and time of report generation
Report section that indicates the spot-check records in the report
Report section that indicates the Continuous data in the report
Report section that indicates the Last spot-check record time
Name of the report. ECG report displays electrocardiogram waveforms and ECG-related vitals like heart rate   and ST measurements for cardiac evaluation.
Section of the table in ECG report  displaying numerical ECG   measurements such as heart rate, ST segment values
The frequency range used to capture and display the ECG signal in the ECG report, typically measured in   Hz.
Indicates the ECG signal is   recorded without the influence of an implanted pacemaker in the ECG report
Name of the report. Alarm limits report displays the upper and lower threshold settings for vital parameters   used to trigger alarms.
Table Section that displays list of the upper and lower threshold settings for vital parameters used to   trigger alarms.
Name of the report. Event log report lists all monitoring events such as alarms, lead status changes, and   limit adjustments with precise timestamps.
Table Section that displays list of all the monitoring activities such as alarms, lead status with precise   timestamps.
Section of the table in Real-time report displaying the alarm data at the triggered time
Section of the waves in Real-time report displaying the captured wave data at the triggered time
Name of the report. A medical   report that displays continuous physiological data recordings (such as ECG,   vital signs) in a strip chart format for analysis and documentation
Label for the date and time   field indicating when the physiological data recording was captured
Header for the first heart rate   event section in the strip chart gridlines
